Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk cpp
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: gcc bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The gcc packages provide compilers for C, C++, Java, Fortran, Objective C, and Ada 95 GNU, as well as related support libraries. This update fixes the following bugs: An application binary interface (ABI) incompatibility of hardware transactional memory (HTM) built-in and intrinsic functions was discovered between PowerPC and System z. To mitigate the incompatibility, a new macro has been added to the PowerPC Linux htmintrin.h file. This new macro defines the return value of the __TM_simple_begin() and __TM_begin() intrinsic functions. As a result, users are now able to write code that can be shared between PowerPC and System z systems. (BZ#1098279) Previously, the instruction scheduling pass treated debug instructions with volatile inline assembly as a barrier. As a consequence, GCC could miscompile certain programs containing inline assembly when using the "-g" option to generate the debug info. A fix to the instruction scheduler has been applied, and the code is now compiled correctly. (BZ#1127120) Previously, the standard uncaught_exception() function returned the true value even when initialization of the exception object was not complete. As a consequence, GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) could generate incorrect code. With this update, uncaught_exception() returns the true value only after the exception object is created, and GCC generates correct code. (BZ#1085444) Previously, the GNU OpenMP library (libgomp) in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 did not support OpenMP 4.0, while Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.0 included this support. Consequently, applications built with Red Hat Developer Toolset 3.0 and using libgomp could not link on Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. This update adds support for OpenMP 4.0 to libgomp, and the applications now link correctly. (BZ#1099547) Previously, GCC could expand the HTM __builtin_ttest() function into an incorrect instruction. As a consequence, the compiler generated incorrect code for this built-in function. The expansion has been fixed, and the described problem no longer occurs. (BZ#1100387) Prior to this update, the OpenMP artificial functions generated by the compiler did not contain the "DW_AT_name" attribute. Consequently, it was impossible to print variables residing in an OpenMP region in the GNU debugger. This bug has been fixed, "DW_AT_name" is now properly set, and it is possible to print variables also in OpenMP regions. (BZ#844959) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: This GCC update introduces improved performance for the IBM System z hardware. (BZ#1088542) Users of gcc are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
